title: Matroid reinforcement and sparsification
abstract:
Homogeneous matroids are characterized by the property that strength equals
fractional arboricity, and arise in the study of base modulus [22]. For graphic
matroids, Cunningham [9] provided efficient algorithms for calculating graph
strength, and also for determining minimum cost reinforcement to achieve a
desired strength. This paper extends this latter problem by focusing on two
optimal strategies for transforming a matroid into a homogeneous one, by either
increasing or decreasing element weights. As an application to graphs, we give
algorithms to solve this problem in the context of spanning trees.
